AboutSection.Section1: Hello I'm Tait Wayland. I've been doing UI design and development for about 3 years. I'm a product designer at TicketBiscuit. I formerly captained a Code for America brigade,

header.header2: iâ€™m a ui designer and developer living in birmingham, alabama.

ldjson.description: I'm a ui designer and developer living in Birmingham, Alabama.
ldjson.name: Tait Wayland

sections.title: User Research
sections.description: I give users the respect they deserve by listening. I conduct user interviews, and I make personas. I fight on the hill of user needs.

sections.title: Process
sections.description: I follow the conventional iterative flow: discover, decide, make, and validate. I conduct user research, I then wireframe and prototype. I validate with user tests.

sections.title: Responsive Design
sections.description: Mobile first, almost always. Relative sizing. Every time you hardcode a 'px' value, Domo kills a kitten.

sections.title: App Design
sections.description: I respect iOS and Material Design guidelines. Furthermore, a new screen isn't always the most elegant solution. Utilize 3D touch, notifications, fingerprints, VUIs, wearables, and GPS when and wherever possible.

sections.title: Front End Development
sections.description: Designers should write code. I know the basics and I'm always looking to grow. HTML5, SASS, Javascript, Jquery, AngularJS, and some ASPNET. (I made site this with <3 and Angular 1)

sections.title: UX Specialties
sections.description: My first priority is accessiblity. My second is scalability. I follow atomic design principles and reduce things to their simplest forms. I'm an advocate of semantic markup, and structured SASS. I value style guides.
